verses.roman:
ūṣuḥ sarasvatī-tīre
jalaṁ prāśya yata-vratāḥ
rajanīṁ tāṁ mahā-bhāgā
nanda-sunandakādayaḥ

synonyms: ūṣuḥ—they stayed; sarasvatī-tīre—on the bank of the Sarasvatī; jalam—water; prāśya—subsisting on; yata-vratāḥ—taking strict vows; rajanīm—the night; tām—that; mahā-bhāgāḥ—the greatly fortunate ones; nanda-sunandaka-ādayaḥ—Nanda, Sunanda and the others.
translation: Nanda, Sunanda and the other greatly fortunate cowherds spent that night on the bank of the Sarasvatī, strictly observing their vows. They fasted, taking only water.

purport.content: Śrīla Viśvanātha Cakravartī explains that Sunanda is the younger brother of Nanda Mahārāja.
